@thenoobish,

Hi can somebody tell me how can I reinstall Driver San Francisco on my MacBook Pro 13" (2011)

I'd installed it using the wrong method, so I deleted it from the applications folder.

I have tried to reinstall and re-download Driver San Francisco again and again.

And the message keep saying this:
"Driver San Francisco is already installed on your system. Please run uninstall script and launch installer again to reinstall the game."

Please Can Someone help me to solve this problem issue. Thank's! :)

@LoveLyricalRideX
1. Go to Macintosh HD -> Library -> Preferences.
2. Delete 2 files:
i) com.ubisoft.DriverSanFrancisco­.GameUpdate.plist
ii) com.Ubisoft.Launcher.plist
You should be able to reinstall after deleting﻿ this.
you won't find the /ubisoft/ folder in (yourname)/library/application support!! you have to go to macintosh hd/library/application support and there you'll find the ubisoft folder
